alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 21 at 10:55AM MST until September 21 at 2:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR MARICOPA COUNTY... At 1055 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms had produced heavy rain in Centennial Wash. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The county flood control stream gage for Centennial Wash has exceeded Alarm Stage and continues to rise. The downstream road crossing at Old US 80 will be impacted. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Buckeye, Palo Verde, Painted Rock Dam, Arlington and Hassayampa. This includes the following streams and drainages... Rainbow Wash, Centennial Wash, Enterprise Canal, Hassayampa River, Gila River and Arlington Canal. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
